text: Brickellia jimenezii is a Mexican species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It is native to the State of Guerrero in western Mexico.Hinojosa Espinosa, Oscar & Cruz Durán, Ramiro 2010. Novon 20(1): 43-46; figure 1 in English with diagnosis in Latin and summary in Spanish; line drawings on page 44The International Plant Names Index Brickellia jimenezii is an annual herb up to 80 cm (32 inches) tall. It produces many small flower heads with cream- colored disc florets but no ray florets. It is found in roadside ravines in tropical deciduous forest. The species is named for Mexican botanist Jaime Jiménez Ramírez. ==References== jimenezii Category:Flora of Guerrero Category:Plants described in 2010
title: Brickellia jimenezii
